title: HELP IM LOSING EVERY RANKED GAME!
body: I made an earlier post about it but I cant find it, and I dont know why its me losing every ranked game. My ranked game losing streak is 11 losses, and I tried everything to help my losing team. HELP!

replies.body: Take a break.
Probably on tilt. Just take a break from ranked for at least a day. Maybe play some bot games you know you can win.
Try something different. Try to main other lane or something like this. It helps a lot when u tilt.

Taking a quick look, you have no ranked history and you primarily play with low to mid Bronze players in normal games.

Your Ranked MMR defaults to approximately Silver 4 when you start assuming you have no previous ranked games in another season.  

Since your approximate skill level is below that, you are currently losing games and falling.  This will continue until you reach a ranking more appropriate for your current level of skill.
------------------------
I'd recommend you stop playing ranked games until you have gained more experience and improved your gameplay.  

You don't even have full pages of Tier 3 runes yet, so you are starting most games with an immediate stat disadvantage.  In addition, you are running the wrong mastery pages on most champions.
I'm using the wrong masteries? My mastery pages are the ones the professional teams recommend. And I know which champions are ad or ap, so I'm fine.

If you want a few examples:

* You are taking Thunderlord's Decree on Yasuo.  Fervor of Battle and Warlord's Bloodlust are both better options.
* You are taking Warlord's Bloodlust or Stormraider's Surge on Lee Sin.  Thunderlord's Decree or Strength of the Ages are generally better.
* You are taking Bond of Stone or Stormraider's Surge on Shen top.  Grasp of the Undying is better.
* You are taking Stormraider's Surge on Wukong.  Thunderlord's Decree is usually better.
* You are taking Thunderlord's Decree on Master Yi.  Fervor of Battle is better.
* You are taking Warlord's Bloodlust on Pantheon.  Thunderlord's Decree or Deathfire Touch are better.

There are many more examples. 

In addition, your item builds are rather questionable.  You don't really seem to build situationally (i.e. continuing to build damage when you are far behind rather than getting tanky, not building situationally, building items in the wrong order or building the wrong items, etc).

You have a lot of room to improve.  I'd recommend you check out probuilds.net or champion.gg to get a starting point for builds, runes and masteries until you figure it out.
Can you give me some correct mastery pages?

Look at the champions Champion.gg page.  It displays the most common and highest win rate rune and mastery builds for champions used by players in Platinum+.

You have to take it with a grain of salt (since the highest winrate builds are often something you would build if you were already ahead), but it is a useful resource.
Find four other friends you trust
Sign up for replay.gg so we can watch your games and give advice, and you can review your deaths and how they happened exactly and what you could have done

Things I noticed:

You frequently do poor early, but continue to build damage. Start building tank on Wukong if you fall behind. 

Support Lee Sin is not good unless you are really good with Lee Sin. Don't do it.

You don't look to be that good with Teemo. Stop playing him top, he is very unforgiving if you fall behind.

You had no kills with Lux and 4 deaths and 0 assists but you completed meijis? 

My guess is that you fall behind in lane and try to "catch-up" with a kill or gank. If this fails you are probably 2 deaths behind. At that point you are unlikely to catch up with your current skill.

Just farm. Literally don't worry about kills, poke, what your jungler is doing, how the other lanes are going: just farm. Get items then try to team fight. You are Wukong, you can literally get 0 kills in lane and still be highly relevant in every teamfight.

I would also recommend TP over ignite, because you need it to avoid missing CS. You clearly are not getting the kills to justify taking it.

How'd you deduce all that? I try to farm but when my opponent is doing damage I would be about to die? What you say is correct, I think: I frequently lose lane early while trying to keep up and miss farm. Now that you mention it, farming is very important. I mostly took ignite to get kills, but for top lane it is bad, thank you for clarifying it. All-in-all, your analysis was great and gave me some skills I need to work on.

> [{quoted}](name=TheDarkFighterz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nAKXFH8c,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2016-07-21T01:39:59.585+0000)
>
> How'd you deduce all that? I try to farm but when my opponent is doing damage I would be about to die? What you say is correct, I think: I frequently lose lane early while trying to keep up and miss farm. Now that you mention it, farming is very important. I mostly took ignite to get kills, but for top lane it is bad, thank you for clarifying it. All-in-all, your analysis was great and gave me some skills I need to work on.

I looked at you CS average per game, your summoners, and your deaths. Your CS per game is low, you take ignite instead of TP which means an early death puts your really behind, and your deaths per game are relatively high. 

I am a top lane main. I have idea when a player falls behind by looking at the stats and it is a LONG walk back to lane if you die early. Meaning you miss CS and XP. By the time you get back to lane after an early death you opposing laner may be one full level up on you and could easily kill you again.

A lot of lower skill players focus on trading or attacking instead of farming. 

Just farm, avoid hits, and bring sustain to the lane. Learn to farm under tower (2 tower shot on melees then an auto and one auto-attack then turret shot then auto attack on casters).

I really think if you just farm you will win more games. In your Elo if you focus on farming you will eventually be stronger than your opposing laner because they probably stink at farming. Just don't die and use your TP to get back to lane if you get low. 

Almost never cross the river ever unless you have visual of the opposing jungler and mid-laner.

I play {{champion:75}} so I learned really early to keep up in CS against my opposing laner. I also know my champion's early game sucks compared to most, so I have to be careful with early trading. Wukong is strong early so you can afford to trade if you want, just don't do it too much and make sure to last hit minions.
also don't forget that sometime it is inevitable that you get bad team mates and lose badly. its random you know.

> [{quoted}](name=Calabok,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nAKXFH8c,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2016-07-21T02:19:01.687+0000)
>
> also don't forget that sometime it is inevitable that you get bad team mates and lose badly. its random you know.

Did you see his match history ? That's a fucktonne of bad luck. I can relate though. I was B2 a month or so ago and now I'm in B5. It wasn't as harsh as I'm seeing with him based on his match history but it was long fall nonetheless.

> [{quoted}](name=TheDarkFighterz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nAKXFH8c,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-07-19T00:05:45.355+0000)
>
> I made an earlier post about it but I cant find it, and I dont know why its me losing every ranked game. My ranked game losing streak is 11 losses, and I tried everything to help my losing team. HELP!

just learn some new skills then go back. 

Tell me, on what day did your loss streak begin. Or just link me to match history
http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=thedarkfighterz

> [{quoted}](name=TheDarkFighterz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nAKXFH8c,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2016-07-20T21:55:27.906+0000)
>
> http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=thedarkfighterz

well this is easy

You suck at stuff and you are bronze 1

you are at a place where you must have skills beyond what is suggested by the rank to break from gravity so to speak.

You do bad at things you have no practice with.
You do worse at things you have worse practice with

you don't build to carry it seems. Your most successful vi build that seems to have gotten you anywhere seems to be outdated.

Thats not correct, I assure you. That is all I can say. Mostly, and this is true, bot or mid is falling behind, and due to that I try to win lane, but after, no offense, the opponents getting some kills and getting "fed", they just 4 or 5 v 1 all lanes for some reason, and I lose my lane in like five seconds because their entire team is just roasting me.
When the enemy team is fed, you need to rely more on wards and don't push out as much.  Play safe, stay alive.

You seem to be having a lot of success as Vi Jungle in normals, but don't seem to be taking that skill into ranked.  That's my number one point of advice for winning more ranked games - play champs you're good at in ranked, and experiment with others in normals.  You seem to be doing the opposite, based on your match history.

My second point of advice is to avoid dying.  You seem to have a lot of deaths, and most are likely avoidable.  You're taking too many needless risks - try to play more safe and get a farm lead over your opponents instead of always going for kills.

Hmmm... I had a similar experience like this but in normals... I think it's just you're on tilt or maybe you just got unlucky from horrible teammates, but after you get one win, everything is probably going to go back to normal, at least that's what happened to me lol. But in all seriousness, I think that you should just stop playing League for a while and then come back when you feel better. Also, try to take a break between each game to reduce stress. Before each game, always think to yourself, **I AM GOING TO WIN**. Always keep a positive outlook on things and never complain. So, good luck!

http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=thedarkfighterz

I assure you, this is not a hack link. Its op.gg.

op.gg is worse lol :P

There was this tip from a pro about playing Normal game until you win three which I did but then I lost ranked game again? OMG LOL IS TRICKING ME the game started fine but then enemy team swarmed mid then bot.! ILLUMINATI CONFIRMED
Becomes boosted animal. Welcome to season 6

INB4GITGUD comments:
https://67.media.tumblr.com/a3a14802cf75c7d06d6c52554c7feee9/tumblr_oaa9l9SmcO1rbcglxo1_540.png
Sorry to copy skrill and tyrone, but i'd definitely take a break. Also, i'd mute anyone who seems toxic in your game and save yourself a lot of time typing and possibly a loss.
